      void addFavorite(Map<String,Object> params, ISirqulCallback<WrappedResponse<?>> callback)
      Adds an offer, retailer location, or category to your favorites.

      Target API Endpoint: /favorite/create

      Available parameters for this api SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
      the account ID of the user (deviceId or accountId required, deviceId sent automatically) SirqulKeys.favoritableId
      The id of the object to favorite {offerId, offerLocationId, retailerLocationId, categoryId} SirqulKeys.favoritableType
      The type of the object to favorite {OFFER, OFFER_LOCATION, RETAILER_LOCATION, CATEGORY} SirqulKeys.location of type Location
      the current location of the user
      SirqulResponse subclass type:
      On invalid response: SirqulResponse.

    • Method Detail

      • addFavorite

        public void addFavorite(Map<String,Object> params,
               ISirqulCallback<WrappedResponse<?>> callback)
        Adds an offer, retailer location, or category to your favorites.

        Target API Endpoint: /favorite/create

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account ID of the user (deviceId or accountId required, deviceId sent automatically)
        • SirqulKeys.favoritableId
          The id of the object to favorite {offerId, offerLocationId, retailerLocationId, categoryId}
        • SirqulKeys.favoritableType
          The type of the object to favorite {OFFER, OFFER_LOCATION, RETAILER_LOCATION, CATEGORY}
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          the current location of the user

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        On invalid response: SirqulResponse. On valid response: OFFER and OFFER_LOCATION favoirtes will return WrappedResponse< OfferResponse>, RETAILER_LOCATION favoirtes will return WrappedResponse <ListingRetailerLocation>, CATEGORY favorites will return WrappedResponse< ListingCategory >
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        FavoriteApiBase.addFavorite

      • getFavorite

        public void getFavorite(Map<String,Object> params,
               ISirqulCallback<WrappedResponse<?>> callback)
        Retrieves a single favorited item.

        Target API Endpoint: /favorite/get

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account ID of the user (deviceId or accountId required, deviceId sent automatically)
        • SirqulKeys.favoriteId
          The id of the favorite object you're requesting {offerId, offerLocationId, retailerLocationId, categoryId}
        • SirqulKeys.favoritableType
          The type of the favorite object you're requesting for {OFFER, OFFER_LOCATION, RETAILER_LOCATION, CATEGORY}
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          the current location of the user

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        On invalid response: SirqulResponse. On valid response: OFFER and OFFER_LOCATION favorites will return WrappedResponse< OfferResponse>, RETAILER_LOCATION favorites will return WrappedResponse <ListingRetailerLocation>, CATEGORY favorites will return WrappedResponse< ListingCategory >
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        FavoriteApiBase.getFavorite

      • removeFavorite

        public void removeFavorite(Map<String,Object> params,
                  ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Removes a favorited item from the user's favorites list.

        Target API Endpoint: /favorite/delete

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The account ID of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        • SirqulKeys.favoriteId
          The ID of the favorite reference record
        • SirqulKeys.favoritableId
          The ID of the object to un-favorite {offerId, offerLocationId, retailerLocationId, categoryId} (this is required if favoriteId is NOT passed in)
        • SirqulKeys.favoritableType
          The type of the object to un-favorite {OFFER, OFFER_LOCATION, RETAILER_LOCATION, CATEGORY} (this is required if favoriteId is NOT passed in)

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        FavoriteApiBase.removeFavorite(...)

      • searchFavorites

        public void searchFavorites(Map<String,Object> params,
                   ISirqulCallback<SearchResponse<?>> callback)
        Gets all of the user's favorites.

        Target API Endpoint: /favorite/search

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account ID of the user (deviceId or accountId required, deviceId sent automatically)
        • SirqulKeys.connectionAccountId
          The ID of an account the user would like to view favorites for
        • SirqulKeys.favoritableType
          The type of the object to favorite {OFFER, OFFER_LOCATION, RETAILER_LOCATION, CATEGORY}
        • SirqulKeys.keyword
          The keyword to search for
        • SirqulKeys.sortField
          Determines what to sort the results by {CREATED, UPDATED, DISPLAY}
        • SirqulKeys.descending
          Determines whether the results are in descending order
        • SirqulKeys.start
          The start index for pagination
        • SirqulKeys.limit
          The limit for pagination (there is a hard limit of 1000)
        • SirqulKeys.activeOnly
          Determines whether to only return active favorites
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          the current location of the user

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        On invalid response: SirqulResponse. On valid response: OFFER and OFFER_LOCATION favoirtes will return SearchResponse< OfferResponse>, RETAILER_LOCATION favoirtes will return SearchResponse< ListingRetailerLocation>, CATEGORY favoirtes will return SearchResponse< ListingCategory >
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        FavoriteApiBase.searchFavorites
